if you want to remove stumps quickly and

backhoe even the largest dumps come out

by the stumps as well but it costs about
500 a day and it takes a little bit of
finesse and room to be able to operate
one of these pieces of equipment
a good alternative is a stump grinder
they can be as small as a rototiller or
as big as a bobcat they cost between 100
to 400 a day and they can grind up at a
very large stump in about an hour stump
grinders are really easy to use but you
do have to do some prep work and digging
you have to cut this down flush to the
ground and then you want to remove any
soil or rocks from around the stump to
avoid damaging the grinder stump
grinders generally don't get the roots
but they will remove the stump to about
two to four inches below the soil
surface
if you have a dry old brittle stump you
can use a chainsaw to make some plunge
cuts into the stump in a checkerboard
pattern and then use a sledge hammer and
some wedges to break the stump up and
take it out this method is still a lot
of manual labor and it'll trash your
chainsaw blade if the blade touches the
dirt or rocks but it works pretty well
on dry brittle old stumps there's many
products online that claim to help
stumps biodegrade or break down and i've
seen videos of people trying to use
epsom salts however i've not seen any
evidence that these things actually work
and it takes many years if not decades
for a stump to biodegrade
